result.execSummary:
The defendant Yiovanni G Petrie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Flee Or Elude An Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber release to be determined by HOC staff and Day Reporting Center.  Court does not object to electronic monitoring.
Court does not object to early term probation if deemed appropriate by the agent.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute sobriety.

No possession of controlled substances/alcohol without a valid prescription.
No possession of firearms/ammunition/magazines/holsters/body armor.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
Pursue full time/part time employment and/or education.
Court allows for expungement if defendant successfully completes probation.

DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following within 18 months. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including DNA.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes:
IMPOSED AND STAYED:  to be used at discretion of the agent.
Huber release to be determined by HOC staff and Day Reporting Center.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Yiovanni G Petrie

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Yiovanni G Petrie in court.  Attorney Jonathan Carver Smith in court for Yiovanni G Petrie.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

The Court ordered defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 2 days time served. Huber release to be determined by HOC staff and Day Reporting Center. Court does not object to electronic monitoring. 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 18 MONTHS probation. Court does not object to early term probation if deemed appropriate by the agent.

Conditions of Probation:
- 30 DAYS condition time in the HOC imposed and stayed to be used at the discretion of the agent. Huber release to be determined by HOC staff and Day Reporting Center. 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute sobriety.
- DNA sample.
- No possession of controlled substances/alcohol without a valid prescription.
- No possession of firearms/ammunition/magazines/holsters/body armor. 
- Pursue full time/part time employment and/or education.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Court ordered defendant's driving privileges REVOKED for 6 months. 

- Court allows for expungement if defendant successfully completes probation 

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following within 18 months.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA); 

20 day appeal rights given,
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his/her right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Letters for Consideration at Sentencing, filed.

Defendant Yiovanni G Petrie in court.  Attorney Jonathan Carver Smith in court for Yiovanni G Petrie.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 

Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 11.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instruction, filed.

Defendant Yiovanni G Petrie in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Dennis Patrick Murphy for Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.  Based on defendants appearance in court, Court cancels stayed bench warrant.  Defense is not ready to proceed with plea and sentencing and requested a projected plea date.  Court grants defense request.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 11.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jonathan Carver Smith in court.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Smith has had good contact with the defendant.  Defendant mis-calendered today's scheduled hearing.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Jonathan Carver Smith in court.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failed to appear due to miscalendaring the event.  Attorney Smith has been in good contact with the defendant.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Yiovanni G Petrie in court with Attorney Jonathan Carver Smith; both appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.

*Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 050199,
Payable Number: 1009409,
Receipt Number: 22RP021621,
Amount: $20.00
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Yiovanni G Petrie in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Yiovanni G Petrie in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Yiovanni G Petrie appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.    DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
